title.narrative: KSE public financial management certificate program
KSE utbildning i offentlig ekonomisk förvaltning

description.narrative:
Kyiv School of Economics (KSE) har lämnat in en ansökan om 670 000 SEK för implementering av utbildningsprogrammet i förvaltning av de offentliga finanserna “KSE public financial management certificate program” i Ukraina under perioden 2018-2019.
KSE:s utbildningsprogram är ett praktiskt utbildningsprogram som syftar till att förbättra kunskapen hos offentliga tjänstemän på mellanchefsnivå på området offentliga finanser och policyanalys. Programmet kommer att kombinera teori och praktik för att förse deltagarna med den kompetens som är nödvändig för aktivt deltagande i reformprocesserna.
Programmet kommer att rikta in sig på offentliga tjänstemän på mellanchefsnivå som arbetar på Finansministeriet, den ukrainska skattemyndigheten och de finansiella departementen vid linjeministerierna (enhetschefer till exempel). En separat Training of Trainers (ToT)-grupp kommer att etableras för lärare på området PFM. Programmet kommer att omfatta 60 deltagare. Programmet kommer att implementeras av Kyiv School of Economics, avdelningen för offentlig politik och förvaltning. Programmet kommer att delas upp i åtta tvådagarsmoduler under perioden september 2018 - juni 2019.
Insatsens totala budget är EUR 164 126. Sveriges bidrag uppgår till EUR 65 027 (SEK 670 000) och GIZ medel uppgår till EUR 99 099. Koordinering bland givarna har säkerställts: budgetarna har redan fastställts av parterna.
Styrningen av programmet är helt och hållet KSE:s ansvar och GIZ har tagit på sig en kontrollerande roll som en extern garant för programmets kvalitet.
Programmet kommer att ha genderbudgetering som ett övergripande tema i kursplanen. KSE kommer då att få stöd från experterna från Gender Responsive Budgeting-projektet som stöds av Sverige. En separat modul på området genderbudgetering ska inkluderas i kursen och experten från Gender Responsive Budgeting-projektet kommer att ge råd kring hur genderaspekter kan integreras i kursens övriga delar.
Aktivitetsperioden är 24.07.2018 - 31.05.2019. Avtalsperioden är 24.07.2018 - 31.10.2019.

Kyiv School of Economics has applied to the Embassy for funding of 670 000 SEK to carry out the "KSE public financial management certificate program" in Ukraine during 2018-2019.
"KSE public financial management certificate program” is a practice-oriented non-degree educational programme that aims to improve knowledge and skills of mid-management level public officials on public finance and policy analysis. The programme will combine theory and practice in order to provide soft and hard skills needed for active and educated participation in the reforms processes.
The program is aimed at the mid-management public officials working in the Ministry of Finance, State Fiscal Service of Ukraine and financial departments/directorates of the line ministries (heads of units and directors of department). A separate ToT (training of trainers) group will be formed for the teachers of the public financial management (PFM) to the civil servants as a part of regular career development courses. The overall number of participants will be 60 people. The program is implemented by Kyiv School of Economics, Department of Public Policy and Governance. The program will be organised in 8 two-day modules with a policy paper to be prepared by the students at the end of the program. The timeline for the program is September 2018 - June 2019.
The intervention's total budget is EUR 164 126, of which Swedish funding is SEK 670 000 (or EUR 65 027) and GIZ funding is EUR 99 099. Donor coordination and cooperation is ensured: budgets have been previously agreed between partners.
The management of the program is the full responsibility of KSE, and GIZ is taking a controlling role as an external guarantor of the quality.
The Programme will have the gender budgeting as the crosscutting issue in the curriculum of the course. With that aim, the KSE will acquire support from the experts of Gender Responsive Budgeting project supported by Sweden in Ukraine. The curriculum will have a separate module on gender budgeting, and the expert of Gender Responsive Budgeting project will provide consultations on how to integrate gender aspects in other parts of the course.
The activity period is 24.07.2018 - 31.05.2019 The agreement period is 24.07.2018 - 31.10.2019

The intended outcomes of the project are as follows: 1. Changed paradigm of thinking of civil servants on implementing reforms by enhancing their knowledge of public policy, leadership skills, process management, and managing changes. 2. The trainers on Public Finance Management (PFM) become the agents of changes capable of further teaching the students.

description.narrative: The following results were achieved in the project: 1. The amount of participants was 44 civil servants and 18 faculty members, in total 62 people, of whom 58 participants received certificates for program completion (42 civil servants and 16 faculty members), and 4 others – the certificates for participation in the program (people who either left civil service during the program or missed more than 25% of the trainings). 2. The graduates of the program gained a better professional knowledge of the policy analysis, international aspects of public finance, improved their soft skills and became ready to further transfer that knowledge to peers and students. 3. Networking opportunities provided for the civil servants is one of the largest benefits of the program in terms of creating a vibrant community of reform-minded professionals who would be change agents in their institutions. 4. The graduates are expected to use their newly possessed skills and experience for the elaboration of strategic plans, policy elaboration, analysis and evaluation, interactions with local and international partners, and for their personal career growth when applying on the higher positions. The values adapted via the participation in the program are expected to be used on a day-to-day basis in the work and personal life.
